item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has concluded with 4,087 companies reporting results, revealing a nuanced picture of corporate performance across market capitalisations. While aggregate profit growth remains modest, sectoral and size-based disparities continue to shape investor sentiment as the market navigates a complex macroeconomic backdrop. Time: 27 minutes ago

item.title: Star Health & Allied Insurance Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Star Health & Allied Insurance Company Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, raising concerns about the stock's medium to long-term momentum and investor sentiment. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Artemis Medicare Services Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Artemis Medicare Services Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development often signals a shift towards a bearish trend and suggests a deterioration in the stock’s medium to long-term momentum. Investors should carefully analyse the implications of this event amid the company’s current financial and market performance. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Nila Spaces Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Nila Spaces Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Realty sector, has recently formed a Death Cross as its 50-day moving average (DMA) crossed below the 200-DMA, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This technical development, coupled with deteriorating momentum indicators and a downgrade in its Mojo Grade to Sell, raises concerns about the stock’s near to medium-term outlook despite its strong historical performance. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Balkrishna Industries Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Balkrishna Industries Ltd (BIL), a prominent player in the Tyres & Rubber Products sector, has recently formed a Golden Cross—a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) has crossed above the 200-DMA. This development suggests a potential bullish breakout and a shift in long-term momentum, offering investors a fresh perspective on the stock’s future trajectory. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has delivered a nuanced picture of corporate performance across India’s stock market, with 4,087 companies reporting results. While aggregate profit growth remains modest, sectoral and market cap-wise disparities highlight evolving dynamics in corporate earnings momentum. Time: 3 hours ago

item.title: Dev Information Technology Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs 22.57
item.description: Dev Information Technology Ltd’s stock price declined sharply to a new 52-week and all-time low of Rs.22.57 on 25 Feb 2026, marking a significant downturn amid continued underperformance relative to its sector and benchmark indices. Time: 5 hours ago

item.title: Uma Exports Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Continued Downtrend
item.description: Uma Exports Ltd has reached a new 52-week low, with its share price touching an intraday low of ₹27.51, just 1.98% above its lowest level of ₹27.25 recorded over the past year. This marks a significant decline for the stock, which has been on a downward trajectory for the last nine consecutive trading sessions, losing 15.91% in returns during this period. Time: 5 hours ago

item.title: Abbott India Ltd. Stock Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Underperformance
item.description: Abbott India Ltd. has recently touched a 52-week low, closing just 1.49% above its lowest price point of Rs 26,006.3. This marks a significant moment for the pharmaceutical and biotechnology company as it continues to face headwinds reflected in its stock performance and valuation metrics. Time: 5 hours ago

item.title: Integra Essentia Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low Amid Continued Downtrend
item.description: Integra Essentia Ltd’s shares have declined to a fresh 52-week low, closing at ₹1.32 on 25 Feb 2026, marking a significant milestone in the stock’s ongoing downward trajectory. This new low reflects persistent headwinds faced by the FMCG company amid broader market dynamics and company-specific performance factors. Time: 5 hours ago
